intro: Persoonia rigida var. revoluta, commonly known as the narrow-leaf geebung, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, leathery leaves and distinctive yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in heathland and open woodland habitats, preferring well-drained soils. It is a shrub that can reach up to 2 meters in height, with branches that often have a reddish-brown color. The flowers are usually arranged in dense clusters and bloom during the warmer months, attracting various pollinators.
